message: What's out there? What's available with wifi vs. 3/4G?
motorola xoom and acer iconia A500 *imho*. They are both equipped with android 3.
Asus eee Pad Transformer looks good. Hard to find, though.
@jmore saw a few at best buy...they look pretty nice. I'm really just shopping around right now until I actually have the extra money to blow on one.
Best android tablet I think is Xoom without competition. The Nook Color is an amazing bargain. And I think the Playbook is actually more consumer ready than android 3
testing actually galaxy G70, 5" version of Galaxy S, but wi-fi only and so far looks good
Eee Pad Transformer is better than the Xoom, it has a snappier experience, and it has a better screen, and it is much cheaper.
@apfeljonas That's what I've seen so far in all the ones I've looked at. Now I just have to convince the wife that we need a couple :)

@apfeljonas Wow, the eee transformer looks slick! FWIW, I've got a rooted color nook running Cyanogen -- it's a full Android 2.3.3 tablet, and it's faster at browsing and gmail than my 1st-gen iPad. The root and install is pretty easy if you have a microSD card lying around, with a USB card reader.
Google now makes tablets? Oh great. What other things will they make. Their core competency is selling text ads. They should stick to that.
@operator would I be wrong to guess you own at least one, but probably many, Apple products?
I've been using the Galaxy Tab 10.1 and it's been a nice tablet.  I didn't root it, so can't speak to that aspect. The screen is a nice resolution and the battery life is great.
